usefulItems: cling film, large bowl, baking tray and paper, long sharp knife, rolling pin or pasta machine, wire rack, airtight jars or containers, refrigerator, oven
title: Grissini with Parmesan and Herbs

ingredients.content: 20 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
olive oil, for greasing and sprinkling
1 tsp fine sea salt, plus extra for sprinkling

preparations.content: Place Parmesan, cayenne pepper, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, oregano and bay leaf in mixing bowl then grind <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and yeast in mixing bowl then heat <b>1 min/37°C/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl.

Add flour, salt and reserved cheese and herb mix then knead <b>1 min 30 sec/<b>. Transfer to prepared bowl, cover and leave to rise in a warm place for approx. 40 minutes. Scrape down dough inside bowl with spatula then set aside in fridge for 4 hours.
Towards the end of this time, preheat oven to 200°C and line a baking tray with baking paper.

Divide rested dough into five portions and roll in semolina. Using a pasta machine, roll dough out thinly. Cut each piece into thin strips (approx. 5 mm) using a tagliatelle cutter or long sharp knife. Arrange strips on prepared baking tray, sprinkle with olive oil and sea salt. Bake for 8-10 minutes (200°C) until golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack before serving or store in an airtight container until needed.

hintsAndTricks: You can also use a rolling pin to roll out dough.
